meanings.definition: Of only moderate quality; not very good.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant received a mediocre review for its bland food.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed with the mediocre performance of the new phone.
meanings.sent3: The magician's mediocre tricks failed to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: The mediocre weather cast a gloomy shadow over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The mediocre painting lacked depth and emotion.

meanings.definition: A person of mediocre ability or talent.
meanings.sent1: He was known as a mediocre in the world of sports.
meanings.sent2: The team struggled to succeed due to having a mediocre on their roster.
meanings.sent3: The mediocre always tried to stand out in a crowd but never quite managed it.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a mediocre in a sea of exceptional individuals.
meanings.sent5: The mediocre's lackluster performance left much to be desired.
